UI_visible_response: In 2020, a serious accident occurred at the Songzao Coal Mine in Chongqing, China. On September 27, a fire broke out on an uphill conveyor belt with a large dip angle, designated as No. 2, which was used to transport coal1. This fire led to lethal levels of carbon monoxide gas being released, resulting in the tragic deaths of 16 miners due to carbon monoxide poisoning9. Additionally, it is noted that in late September, high carbon monoxide levels trapped miners at this same mine, contributing to further fatalities3. These incidents highlighted significant safety concerns within the coal mining industry in China6.
traffic_visible_response: In 2020, a serious accident occurred at the Songzao Coal Mine in Chongqing, China. On September 27, a fire broke out on an uphill conveyor belt with a large dip angle, designated as No. 2, which was used to transport coal [[1]]. This fire led to lethal levels of carbon monoxide gas being released, resulting in the tragic deaths of 16 miners due to carbon monoxide poisoning [[9]]. Additionally, it is noted that in late September, high carbon monoxide levels trapped miners at this same mine, contributing to further fatalities [[3]]. These incidents highlighted significant safety concerns within the coal mining industry in China [[6]].
